body.name: Stiive Smart Watch for Women, Fitness Tracker with Blood Oxygen and Heart Rate Monitor, Step Counter, IP68 Waterproof Pedometer, 41mm Fintness Watch and Smartwatch Compatible with Android iOS
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 6 hrs 40 mins
features: 【𝟒𝟏𝐦𝐦 𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐜𝐡 𝐒𝐜𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧 & 𝐃𝐈𝐘 𝐖𝐚𝐭𝐜𝐡 𝐅𝐚𝐜𝐞𝐬 】The smartwatch is furnished with a 1.09"/41mm high-definition full-touch color screen, providing you with a distinctive visual experience and an enhanced interactive interface. Three levels of brightness options enable easy readability of information in both sunlight and darkness. The fitness smartwatch offers 50+ free watch faces. Additionally, you have the flexibility to set your favorite photo as the wallpaper on the watch.

【𝐌𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐢𝐩𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐬 𝐌𝐨𝐝𝐞𝐬 & 𝐀𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐢𝐭𝐲 𝐓𝐫𝐚𝐜𝐤𝐢𝐧𝐠】Stiive smartwatch offers various modes, including running, yoga, hiking, outdoor cycling, and more. While you engage in your workout, it will capture real-time data such as heart rate, steps, calories, distance, and active hours.

【𝐀𝐥𝐥-𝐑𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐝 𝐇𝐞𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐡 𝐌𝐚𝐧𝐚𝐠𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭】With a 24/7 heart rate monitor, blood oxygen measurement, and stress level assessment, the smartwatch comprehensively monitors your sleep in three different modes - REM, light, and deep sleep. Stiive smartwatch provides all-encompassing health management to assist you in cultivating a healthier lifestyle.

【𝟕-𝐃𝐚𝐲 𝐋𝐨𝐧𝐠 𝐁𝐚𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐲 𝐋𝐢𝐟𝐞 & 𝐈𝐏𝟔𝟖 𝐖𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐨𝐟 】 Once charged, it can be used for 7 days or provide 30 days of standby time, alleviating charging concerns. This fitness watch adheres to the IP68 waterproof standard, allowing worry-free use while washing hands, face, or even swimming. (Please refrain from using it in baths, saunas, hot springs, etc.)

【𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲 & 𝐄𝐚𝐬𝐢𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐨 𝐔𝐬𝐞】The fitness tracker is compatible with smartphones running Android 6.0 and iOS 9.0 and above, equipped with Bluetooth 4.0. Follow the quick guide provided in the package to initiate your fitness journey in just a few simple steps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smart and Multifaceted
reviews.reviewText: This is my first time purchasing a touch screen smart watch. I have only owned standard watches with no functionality. I did my research and wanted one that offered lots of versatile. I decided on the Stiive smart watch because, it's a great value, easy to use, and loaded with many options. This watch will keep track of the amount of steps I walk in a day. It will monitor your heart rate. Keeps track of how many hours you sleep and many more features. You can also customize your face dial with 100 plus choices or use one of your own pictures. The watch band is adjustable, very soft to the touch, and it is very comfortable when wearing it. To me the watch can be worn with a casual or dressy attire. The size of the face dial makes it very easy to read all of the settings. To connect the devise to your phone, I downloaded the app then I was able to sink the watch to my phone. Best of all this watch will help me to be a little more health conscience of my daily activities.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love this watch, I only have to charge it once a week. I have the pink one and I get compliments on it all the time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Lo uso mucho para hacer ejercicios

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great first Smart watch for a young kid or a trainer watch for an older adult.
reviews.reviewText: After my Michael Kors version of a Galaxy smartwatch died, I wasn't ready to commit to the current versions then available via Samsung, but I really missed my watch. I decided to give this one a go and I must admit how pleasantly surprised I was at it's functionality. Definitely rivals a Samsung more than the Fossil or Kors version does. The band is easily switched out. The face protectors are compatible. Matter of fact, I prefer this watch to the Kors version. I cannot tell you how many times I had to repurchase the charging cord for the Kors one. It seemed to be rather a lemon of a product. The software interface is great and not at all confusing for non-tech types. For the price this watch is, I am shocked not more people have / use it! Excellent pricing onthis product and I truthfully cannot recommend this watch enough!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice but not worth your time
reviews.reviewText: This watch died after just 6 months. I thought it just needed to be charged after going off, but have been charging it now for 24 hours and see no sign of life. Disappointing as prior to this, I found this a cheap but cheerful watch. It looked nice and did the job. But now I realise it was more of a fancy disposable product. Don’t waste your money and time with it. Also, in general and before it completely died, the face is cute when you press a side button to light it, but otherwise the screen is black.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Affordable, Works great, One major flaw
reviews.reviewText: Pros: Looks great, works, text and phone call notifications, auto-syncs with app on phone, VERY affordableCons: the biggest con for me, and the reason I returned it, is the application did funky things to my phone. It didn't matter how I put my settings or what permissions I gave/didn't give, as soon as I downloaded the app and linked the watch, my phone alarms would no longer open on the phone - meaning, when my alarm would go off, I had to physically unlock my phone, select the alarm notification by swiping down from the top of the phone, then turn it off. The same would happen with phone calls but I didn't mind the phone calls so much. The alarm thing was really annoying when it would ring in the morning to wake me up.... Additionally, you cannot answer phone calls or texts on your watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than my Fitbit.
reviews.reviewText: I was kinda sketched out to buy this, but it's one of the best purchases I've ever made on Amazon. Yes, it's big- my arms are not small. But it's realistic and has never gotten in the way of any daily task. It is so straight forward, giving you your steps, heart rate and calories burned. You can switch back and forth on the screens by swiping, to get a specific recording tab, music from your phone, settings for your background, weather, etc.I have NOT taken this underwater or showered with it, however I have worn this under my boxing gloves and during workouts when I'm sweating a ton, has never bothered it. One charge lasts me well over a week.There aren't 7000 things to do on this and that's why I like it. The others seem like they have excessive features that you 1- don't need or 2- don't care about.It's worth the buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly Surprised!! Economical alternative to branded smart watches. I recommend.
reviews.reviewText: Let me tell you why I'm happy with this purchase: To begin with, I haven't really been interested in smart watches, because they seem too complicated for me... and too expensive.Pros:1. The cost of this watch is super affordable.2. Simple menu, easy to navigate after a couple weeks of use.3. Time, date, steps, heart-beat.. all on main screen.4. I am asthmatic and now have instant access to my blood oxygen level.5. I can track my exercise really easily, and the data tracks on the calendar on the mobile app.6. Super comfortable.7. I get my mobile messages & can see if important or not.8. I can set it to remind me to hydrate and move9. Easy to use mobile appCons:1. Sometimes doesn't "wake up" without pushing the button.2. Can't reply to messages.
